name: section
summary: The `<section>` HTML element represents a generic standalone section of a document, which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it. Sections should always have a heading, with very few exceptions.
contentCategories: Flow content, Sectioning content, palpable content.
permittedParents: Any element that accepts flow content. Note that a `<section>` element must not be a descendant of an address element.
implicitAriaRole: region if the element has an accessible name, otherwise no corresponding role
permittedAriaRoles: alert, alertdialog, application, banner, complementary, contentinfo, dialog, document, feed, log, main, marquee, navigation, none, note, presentation, search, status, tabpanel
